channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-8636] CBO: split cbo_correctness test
item.description:
CBO correctness test is extremely annoying - it runs forever, if anything fails it's hard to debug due to the volume of logs from all the stuff, also it doesn't run further so if multiple things fail they can only be discovered one by one; also SORT_QUERY_RESULTS cannot be used, because some queries presumably use sorting.
It should be split into separate tests, the numbers in there now may be good as boundaries.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
jpullokkaran can you review? the change moves tables into test tables, renames t1..3 to cbo_t1..3 and splits the test.
RB at https://reviews.apache.org/r/27401/

CBO correctness tests are organized by increasing complexity by adding in operators.
So i am not sure division by operator is sane.

We need to divy up cbo_correctness.q for sure. Currently, its cruel to ask someone to debug it, if this test fails. I am fine if division happens either on operator basis or some other basis. jpullokkaran any suggestion for division?

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12678346/HIVE-8636.patch

ERROR: -1 due to 101 failed/errored test(s), 6634 tests executed
